newsitem.title: USA: FDA backs Colgate toothpaste for gum disease.
newsitem.headline: FDA backs Colgate toothpaste for gum disease.

text.p: The Food and Drug Administration said Monday it had approved Colgate-Palmolive Co's Colgate Total toothpaste as a safe and effective means of treating gum disease.
FDA said in a statement that the toothpaste, the first to be approved for gum disease, contained triclosan and fluoride.

In controlled studies, Colgate Total performed better than standard fluoride toothpaste in preventing plaque and gingivitis in adults. Its effect on preventing cavities was identical to a standard fluoride toothpaste.
Triclosan, an ingredient found in many antibacterial soaps, is a disinfectant but FDA said its antibacterial properties in the mouth had not been determined.
Colgate Total is intended for adults and children aged 6 and older, although its effects on plaque and gingivitis have not been established in children.
